result.execSummary:
The defendant Darian D Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 05-05-2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank-surcharge imposed.
with credit for 7 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darian D Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 7 days in the House of Correction, with 7 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 5/5/16.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Darian D Robinson in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Darian D Robinson in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Darian D Robinson in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Defendant Darian D Robinson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 09-10-2015 at 01:30pm
